pull.title: [test] Round target fee to 8 decimals in assert_fee_amount
pull.body:
The output would produce arbitrary number of decimal points, sometimes resulting in 9 decimals:
```
AssertionError: Fee of 0.00000415 BTC too low! (Should be 0.000006175 BTC)
```
The above looks like the expected fee is 6175 sats when in reality it's 618.

rename.to: [test] Round target fee to 8 decimals in assert_fee_amount

The output would produce arbitrary number of decimal points, sometimes resulting in 9 decimals:
AssertionError: Fee of 0.00000415 BTC too low! (Should be 0.000006175 BTC)
The above looks like the expected fee is 6175 sats when in reality it's 618.

events.message:
[test] Round target fee to 8 decimals in assert_fee_amount

The output would produce arbitrary number of decimal points, sometimes resulting in 9 decimals:
AssertionError: Fee of 0.00000415 BTC too low! (Should be 0.000006175 BTC)
The above looks like the expected fee is 6175 sats when in reality it's 618.

events.body: Are there other similar places in the code where this kind of change can/should be implemented?  (I'm thinking for future Pull Requests.)
Probably, yeah. I didn't go hunting for them, just fixed this one as it was in my face (and confused me due to thinking the expected was 10x+ the result).
@kallewoof I'm glad that you found it and fixed it.  :)
